urls.title: Horror at destruction of nationally important UK river | The Wildlife Trusts
urls.description: Major damage to River Lugg in Herefordshire will be test case for Government commitment to strengthen wildlife protection.

tweets.text:
A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW

Guardian: @EnvAgency slashes number of water pollution incident visits amid rising fears water industry is now polluting UK rivers with impunity putting the health of river users and unique ecosystems at risk https://t.co/FbjqetyRzY via @Feargal_Sharkey @bilgribs

Of the devastating effects of Phosphates in Water but I'm not Surprised as your a former Eaton boy and those lads can't even row in a straight line from upper to lower Bargemans Bridge.
In future before trying to amend something you know nothing about doing little reading first
